# **Oregon Essentialized Assessment Framework (EAF)**

## **Science – Grade 5**

**Copyright Behavioral Research and Teaching (BRT) 2025**

::: {.section aria-labelledby="“standard1”"}
### **S05ESS1.1 – Brightness of the Sun and Stars**

**ODE Standard:** 5-ESS1-1

**Oregon Science Standard:** Support an argument that the apparent brightness of the Sun and stars is due to their relative distances from Earth.

**Essentialized Standard:** Recognize that the Sun is brighter than other objects on Earth and in space.

**Low, Medium, and High Parameters**

| Level | Description |
|-----------------|-------------------------------------------------------|
| **Low (L)** | Compare the Sun to common objects that do not shine on their own (e.g., toy, rock). |
| **Medium (M)** | Compare the Sun to objects in the sky like clouds, airplanes, or the Moon. |
| **High (H)** | Recognize the Sun is brighter than other stars because it is closer to Earth. |
:::
